title.rendered: Black Rock employees paint shoes with Mission Education children

content.rendered:
As a part of Employee Engagement Programme, Black Rock India employees came forward to spread joy amongst little children by painting plain white shoes into beautiful colors before gifting them to the kids. About 40 volunteers along with 80 students from a Mission Education Centre in Gurugram participated in this artistic activity. After an entire day of fun and craftsmanship, every child walked away with bright and shiny shoes, an assurance of a warm winter, and a heart full of happiness.

Mission Education is a national level programme of Smile Foundation, which is committed to providing basic education and healthcare to underprivileged children. Since its inception in 2002, more than 200,000 underprivileged children have directly benefitted from the Mission Education programme.

Smile Foundation is an NGO in India directly benefitting over 750,000 children and their families every year, through more than 350 live welfare projects on education, healthcare, livelihood and women empowerment, in over 1000 remote villages and slums across 25 states of India.
